item.title: The Debate Countdown: Abraham Lincoln, Trump's jokes and oil
item.description: The debate in four sentences, why we are talking about the 16th president and the oil vote.

item.title: Coronavirus: France puts 46 million under night curfew
item.description: A night-time curfew already affecting nine cities will now cover two-thirds of France.

item.title: Italian held in France on suspicion of 160 rapes and sexual assaults
item.description: The 52-year-old man, wanted in Germany, was detained in north-eastern France.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: The three-year-old orphaned by war
item.description: Hadija’s mum, dad and older sister were killed in the Azerbaijaini town of Ganja.

item.title: Emily in Paris: Netflix hit's creator Darren Star 'not sorry' for 'clichés'
item.description: Darren Star says he intended the critically lambasted show to be "a love letter" to the French city.

item.title: Nigeria End Sars protest: Key protest group says stay at home
item.description: The Feminist Coalition also advises people to follow any curfews in place in their states.

item.title: Coronavirus: North Korea warnings over 'yellow dust coming from China'
item.description: There is no known link between the seasonal dust clouds and Covid-19 but Pyongyang is on high alert.

item.title: Libya rivals sign ceasefire deal in Geneva
item.description: It follows talks between military leaders from the government and representatives of Gen Haftar's forces.

item.title: Poland abortion ruling: Police use pepper spray against protesters
item.description: Pepper spray is used against crowds in Warsaw after Thursday's controversial court ruling.

item.title: Syria conflict: Hundreds mourn assassinated Damascus mufti
item.description: Sheikh Mohammad Adnan al-Afiyuni, a key mediator with Syrian rebels, was killed by a car bomb.

item.title: Huge crowds at India rallies raise Covid fears
item.description: Experts warn flouting of safety rules at India rallies could have devastating consequences.

item.title: Kamchatka: Toxic algae blamed for mass marine death in Russia
item.description: Russian officials say it was algae, rather than man-made factors, behind an incident in the east.

item.title: Fukushima: Contaminated water could damage human DNA, Greenpeace says
item.description: The group says the water has a radioactive substance amid reports it could be released into the sea.

item.title: Composer with dementia whose piano-playing went viral meets students he inspired
item.description: Eighty-year-old Paul Harvey went viral after he was filmed playing piano pieces learned decades ago.

item.title: Quest Sprout: 'The most wholesome thing on the internet'
item.description: Among the horrors of 2020, one small green hero has emerged to bring brief moments of joy.

item.title: Why Nigerian protesters want Beyoncé to be more like Rihanna
item.description: Beyoncé said she wanted to help the anti-police brutality protesters but some were not impressed.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 16 - 22 October 2020
item.description: A selection of the week's best photos from across the continent and beyond.

item.title: Coronavirus: Inside Europe’s most infected area
item.description: Gavin Lee reports from the epicentre of the second wave of the Covid-19 pandemic, which is in Belgium.

item.title: US election: Joe Biden or Donald Trump? Persuading an undecided voter
item.description: Erica listens to her aunt and her friend make their cases for voting Joe Biden or Donald Trump.

item.title: Melbourne lockdown: Cycling trend ‘burbing’ takes off under tight restrictions
item.description: Ben Loke cycled 1,371km whilst under Melbourne's tough restrictions.

item.title: India coronavirus: The Covid doctor whose dance video went viral
item.description: He danced to cheer up his patients - little knowing his video would reach millions.

item.title: Marge Champion: Actress who was model for Disney's Snow White dies at 101
item.description: Actress Marge Champion served as the model for Walt Disney's groundbreaking 1937 animated film.

item.title: Covid: Why is coronavirus so deadly?
item.description: Why does the biology of coronavirus mean it poses such a threat to human life?

item.title: John McAvoy: The ex-armed robber who reformed through sport in high security prison
item.description: His body on the ground, guns pointed at his back, John McAvoy was caught. His life sentence wasn't the end but a new beginning.

item.title: Spotify, Apple Music, Deezer and YouTube found recently hosting racist music
item.description: The BBC found racist, homophobic and anti-Semitic content on Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube Music and Deezer.

item.title: Tanzania's Tundu Lissu: Surviving an assassination attempt to run for president
item.description: Tanzania's Tundu Lissu, who was shot in 2017, hopes to unseat President John Magufuli.

item.title: The apps promising to improve your sex life
item.description: There are a growing number of apps that promise to help with sexual wellbeing, but are they effective?

item.title: India buzzes with fake news of 'civil war' in Pakistan
item.description: Who was behind rumours that police and troops were fighting in Karachi, and what was the motive?

item.title: Nigeria Sars protest: The misinformation circulating online
item.description: Misleading claims about protests against a controversial police unit have been widely shared.

item.title: Barbara Blake Hannah: The first black reporter on British TV
item.description: In 1968 Barbara Blake Hannah got a reporting job with Thames Television, but some viewers strongly objected.

item.title: Thailand protest: Why young activists are embracing Hong Kong's tactics
item.description: Thailand’s activists are increasingly adopting methods used last year by demonstrators in Hong Kong.

item.title: Will cruise ships return to Venice?
item.description: Pressure is mounting on the Italian authorities to decide on the future of cruise ships in Venice.

item.title: 'It was irresponsible' - England-Barbarians off after players breach Covid rules
item.description: England's match against the Barbarians at Twickenham on Sunday is called off after 12 players breached Covid rules.

item.title: Riders take team buses for part of Giro stage in safety protest
item.description: Riders will take team buses halfway through stage 19 of the Giro d'Italia after a protest over safety.

item.title: Nurmagomedov on way to 'GOAT' status - UFC president White
item.description: Khabib Nurmagomedov will be close to becoming the greatest MMA fighter of all time if he wins at UFC 254, says UFC president Dana White.

item.title: The all-time greatest? Rank the best as Pele turns 80
item.description: As we mark Pele's 80th birthday, you can have your say on some of the greatest players of all time.

item.title: Indian cricket great Dev stable after heart surgery
item.description: The former India captain was admitted to hospital on Friday after he complained of chest pain.

item.title: Man Utd striker Rashford and his mum help out at foodbank
item.description: Charity FareShare has named a new warehouse after the footballer's mother, Melanie.

item.title: Presidential debate 2020: Why Abraham Lincoln starred in the final clash
item.description: Trump's comparison of himself with the 16th president on race issues draws Biden's mockery.

item.title: Moderator Kristen Welker named 'clear winner'
item.description: The NBC correspondent is labelled "clear winner" for the way she led the final presidential debate.

item.title: Presidential debate: Decoding Trump and Biden's body language
item.description: A body language expert gives her view on the presidential rivals' final live TV debate.

item.title: What voters made of the encounter
item.description: Two Biden voters. Two Trump voters. Two undecided voters. Did the final debate change anyone's mind?

item.title: US President Donald Trump at debate: Look at India. The air is filthy
item.description: President Trump's 'filthy air' remark drew both anger and introspection from Indians.

item.title: Presidential debate: Trump and Biden spar in final showdown
item.description: Their last time together on stage featured a much more subdued debate with real policy discussions.

item.title: Fact-checking claims on coronavirus and more
item.description: The final face off between Donald Trump and Joe Biden covered a wide range of issues

item.title: Hunter Biden: What was he doing in Ukraine and China?
item.description: What is the background to the claims made by President Trump about Ukraine and the Bidens?

item.title: Presidential debate: Trump and Biden row about Russia and China money
item.description: In the final debate, the candidates accuse each other of being involved with China and Russia deals.

item.title: US and North Korea: Trump and Biden clash over Kim Jong-un relationship
item.description: Biden accuses Trump of "legitimising" North Korea as Trump describes his relationship with Kim Jong-un.

item.title: US election 2020: What are Trump's and Biden's policies?
item.description: Some of President Trump's and Joe Biden's key policies explained and compared.

item.title: Tanzania President John Magufuli: The man who declared victory over coronavirus
item.description: President John Magufuli’s idiosyncratic handling of Covid-19 has put Tanzania in the global spotlight.

item.title: Covid: What the tier rules say about the split between science and politics
item.description: Why does the divergence between science and politics appear to be wider than it has ever been?
